availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Holman Dean (Woodford County, Kentucky, manufacturer and farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, manufacturer and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Dean and Patience Holman Dean. Married to Prudence Johnson Dean. Married to Malinda Rowland Dean in Woodford County, Kentucky, on December 22, 1835. Father of Matilda Dean, Jerry Dean, David T. Dean, Emily Dean, and Charles H. Dean. Resident of Woodford County in 1830. Owned three enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1830. Resident of Woodford County in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1840. Manufacturer in Woodford County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860.

Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Northern District, p. 223.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film 000252323.
